freetext.name: Section 1
freetext.p: Did you ever think: "mmm... all this J2EE stuff is too complex! There must be an easier way to program?" Read the good news: AndroMDA is here to help you! Generating J2EE components quickly and reliably from models drawn in the graphical Unified Modeling Language is the main feature of AndroMDA.

AndroMDA (pronounced: andromeda) is an open source code generation framework that follows the model driven architecture (MDA) paradigm. It takes a UML model from a CASE-tool and generates classes and deployable components (J2EE or other), specific for your application architecture.

This project is the successor of the UML2EJB project which started in July 2002 and generates Enterprise JavaBeans from UML models. Meanwhile, the scope has broadened, the number of developers has increased and so we decided to rename our project. AndroMDA will reuse the code base of
UML2EJB 1.3.x
which is rock solid.

ul.li: migrating the source files to the new CVS repository
changing our base to Netbeans metadata repository (MDR), an implementation of the OMG MOF standard
adding support for non-EJB persistence like JDO or Hibernate
adding support for more CASE tools (MagicDraw, Together CC, etc.)

freetext.p: Please be patient, migrating the whole stuff into a new project takes more time than we thought. So, stay tuned, you will see much more here in the near future. AndroMDA will be as beautiful as the galaxy, promised!

Read more about AndroMDA, using the links on the left side menu. If you start using AndroMDA, we invite you to subscribe to the project's mailing lists. Another intersting place to watch is the Code Generation Network site where you can read an interview with Matthias Bohlen, the lead engineer behind AndroMDA.
